body.para: Calculate the average of one or more numeric expressions to variables for a range of records in the current database file.

para.text: A list of the numeric values to average for each record processed.

para.text: A list of receiving variable or field names which will contain the average results. Variables that either do not exist or are not visible are created as private variables. <

para.text: The portion of the current database file to process. The default is all visible records in <

para.text: A condition that each visible record within the scope must meet, starting with the current record. As soon as the while condition fails, the process terminates. If no <

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: > is specified, having a while condition changes the default scope to the rest of the visible records in the file.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: A condition that each visible record within the scope must meet in order to be processed. If a record does not meet the specified condition, it is ignored and the next visible record is processed.

body.para: Zero (0) values are counted in the AVERAGE unless explicitly ruled out with a FOR condition.
This example averages a single numeric field using a condition to select a subset of records from the database file:
AVERAGE Amount TO nAvgAmount FOR Branch = "100"
